intro: Rhododendron tutcherae var. tutcherae, commonly known as the Tutcherae rhododendron, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in acidic, well-drained soils and thrives in partially shaded to sunny conditions. Its floral display, which ranges from pink to red, makes it a notable ornamental species in horticulture. The variety is distinguished by its compact growth habit and unique coloration, which vary depending on environmental factors.
